ranked_diseases.explanation: Reference case 2 with this diagnosis shows overlapping features including intellectual disability, delayed speech and language development, and notably short attention span which aligns with ADHD. The X-linked inheritance pattern is consistent with male patient.

Reference case 3 demonstrates exact match for all three core features: intellectual disability, delayed speech and language development, and ADHD. Though this case had additional features not present in our patient, the core phenotype matches well.
Reference case 1 shows intellectual disability and delayed speech/language development matching our patient. However, lacks ADHD component. X-linked inheritance consistent with male patient.
Classic X-linked intellectual disability syndrome frequently presenting with ADHD, speech delays, and cognitive impairment in males. One of the most common genetic causes of this phenotypic triad.
While primarily an ADHD susceptibility locus, some forms can present with comorbid intellectual disability and language delays, particularly when severe.
